sa3:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove of Śrāvastī.
sa3:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa3:2.2: “When you don’t know or understand form and don’t stop or become free of desire for it, it’s not possible to stop suffering.
sa3:2.3: Thus, when you don’t know or understand feeling …
sa3:2.6: consciousness and don’t stop or become free of desire for it, it’s not possible to stop suffering.
sa3:3.1: “Monks, if you know and understand form and stop and become free of desire for it, it’s possible to end suffering.
sa3:3.2: Thus, if you know and understand feeling …
sa3:3.5: consciousness and end and become free of desire for it, it’s possible to end suffering.”
sa3:4.1: When the monks heard what the Buddha taught, they rejoiced and approved.
